intro: Cynometra macrocarpa, commonly known as the African tamarind, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellowish flowers. The tree produces large, woody pods that contain edible seeds surrounded by a sticky, acidic pulp. It is valued for its timber, which is durable and used in construction, as well as for its medicinal properties. The plant also plays an important role in local ecosystems and traditional practices.
